file_content.text: You'll get exactly what you're asking for.
Please, don't kill me!
I--I can help you. Whatever you're looking for, I can find it.
I've come to free the Jedi.
Where is Ako Domi?
Ako Domi? Are you really asking to--
Uh, never mind. That's who you want, I can summon him. No problem. Right here....
Now I'm, um, just going to wait over....
Not interested. [Kill him]
No!
Who comes before me?
I am Ako Domi, the lord of Camp 27. No one seeks me out.
Soldiers beg with their final breath to perish rather than look upon my face.
How could you turn against everything you stood for?
Monster!
Because it's a lie. Everything the Jedi teach.
Because it's a lie, sister. Everything they taught us.
Because it's a lie, brother. Everything they taught us.
I can sense no light remaining in your heart.
The dark side is strong here.
I have filled that hole. They call it "light," but it is only emptiness.
And in yours, I sense nothing at all. They call it "light," sister, but it's only emptiness.
And in yours, I sense ignorance. They tell you it's "light," brother, but it's only blankness.
I guess "welcome home," isn't going to cut it?
Oh, boy.
A two-credit criminal playing hero to mask your own inadequacies. Do you dream of the Republic pinning a badge to your breast?
These are your own people you've been killing! Men you served with.
Traitor!
These men spill their planet's secrets at the first touch of hot pokers.
Come back to the Republic. Turn your back on what the Empire made you.
I'm here to rescue you.
How tiresome. Will you offer me mercy now? Healing? A chance to turn back to the light?
I've been here six years. I've seen your Republic heroes turn on each other like dogs for a scrap of meat.
I've seen human nature at its core, and there is no light there.
Don't judge every man by your own weakness.
You're wrong.
There has never been a captive here so noble he did not eventually succumb.
How long do you think you'll last?
There may still be a way to heal you.
I can help you.
It will be a pleasure to see that naivete melt away beneath the torturer's lash.
Not even a pretense of trying to save me? How quickly the Republic turns its back on its ideals.
Slaughter them, my students! Slowly.
Slaughter her, my students! Slowly.
Slaughter him, my students! Slowly.
I don't need you or your pathetic sniveling.
Out of my way.
T--thank you. You won't regret your mercy, I promise--
Attack! We're under attack in chamber eighteen!
You're going to regret this!
Do you want credits? Gold? I hear the Hutts still prefer to deal in precious metals....
Help me free him, and I'll let you go.
I want Ako Domi.
Bring me Ako Domi and a thousand unmarked credits, and you may walk out of here.
What have you got?
Ako Domi? You... you're asking for Ako Domi? But no one's ever--
There's nothing you can offer to make up for your crimes.
Don't try to bribe me.
No, please! I--I didn't want to do it. It's my job. My orders. I had no choice.
You'll die for your crimes.
I'll put you down like a dog.
